© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Buyer Prediction Model
1
Built a predictive model to identify the most likely buyers for a commercial real 
estate property based on past buyer purchases, using density based clustering 
algorithms such as “DBSCAN” and vector techniques such as “one-hot 
transformation”.
Commercial Real Estate Services Company

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Accordion Value Add 
•
Identified key metrics to determine market trends considering commercial real estate transactions over last 14 years
•
Identified important characteristics of a deal by analyzing purchase deals for building the buyer recommendation system
•
Processed deal data into numerical vectors to calculate distance to score buyers, using models such as “one-hot transformation”
•
Potential buyers were clustered using density based clustering algorithms such as “DBSCAN”
Situation
•
The client’s property sales line of business (LOB) was not efficient or targeted because brokers typically approached 5,000+ potential 
property buyers for a deal
•
Partnered with the client to leverage historical transactions data available with the LOB to build a predictive model generating a ranked 
actionable list of potential buyers for a property
2
Impact
•
Developed a buyer recommendation system that provided a ranked actionable list of 100 potential buyers for each property
•
When deals during last two consecutive years in the U.S. were considered, the actual buyer was present in top-100 predicted list in ~60% of 
cases, which made the deal sales process more efficient for the brokers
•
Worked with the client development team to integrate the buyer recommendation system with their internal deal flow management software
Buyer Prediction Model for a Commercial Real Estate Firm

Methodology Flow for Buyer Recommendation System
4
Processed test & train data into 
the required format…
…used vector distance calculations to score buyers based on how similar 
their past purchases were to the test property…
...and recommended the most 
likely buyers
Convert property 
characteristics into 
categorical variables
Categorical variables were 
converted into vectors
To each vectorized property 
characteristic, based on 
importance, weights were 
assigned
Evaluated distances of 
properties from test property
For selected clusters of 
properties, historical buyers were 
identified
Buyers were ranked in 
descending order of 
scores
Lists of top-
50/100/200/300 buyers 
were generated
Based on proximity to test 
property, property clusters were 
selected 
Considering buyers’ properties 
that fall within the selected 
property clusters, each identified 
buyer was scored based on:
•
Mean distance of their 
properties from test property
•
# of buyer’s properties in the 
selected clusters
